post_text: Starting Sept. 7, Rocky Mountain PBS will be airing remote k-3 lessons in literacy, science, art and math through “Colorado Classroom: Learn with Me at Home.”
shared_text:
Governor Jared Polis
September 1 at 11:05 AM ·

I’m excited to share that K-3 students, their families and caregivers will have direct-to-home remote lessons in literacy, science, art and math though “Colorado Classroom: Learn with Me at Home” starting Sept. 7 and airing for 15 weeks on Rocky Mountain PBS

This partnership is a creative way to ensure that young, Colorado learners can continue receiving important lessons in literacy, math, science, art and more. While many students are already back in class, other school districts haven’t begun in person learning yet and we want to do everything we can to support Colorado students, teachers, and parents as we navigate these challenges together.

The website, which will include accompanying lesson plans for families, caregivers and their children will launch the same day at: rmpbs.org/ColoradoClassroom. Thank you to the Colorado Department of Education, The Colorado Education Initiative, Rocky Mountain Public Media, and all the master educators who are making sure students continue receiving quality instruction this fall.

post_text: Garfield County Libraries is hosting a virtual book discussion on "How to Be an Antiracist" next month. Pick up a copy and join this community conversation!
shared_text:
Garfield County Libraries updated their cover photo.
August 17 at 10:43 AM ·

Author Ibram X. Kendi takes readers through a widening circle of antiracist ideas in his bestselling book, "How to Be an Antiracist." Basalt Middle School
March 11 at 8:39 AM ·

STATE AWARD! Today we report some AWESOME news! You might recall that our LEGO Robotics team competed in the state championships earlier this year. Due to the weather, they left before the awards ceremony, and it turns out they won The Judges Award! The Judges Award means the state judges noticed the team and were impressed with their teamwork and perseverance. The award is called "Practice Makes Perfect" and here's the judges' narrative:

"They take the phrase “friends are family” to the next level with their team’s bond. Their enthusiasm and sense of fun was contagious even through 3 rebuilds of their robot today. They take the phase try, try, again to the next level."

Congratulations to our LEGO Robotics team on their incredible attitude and state trophy!

What are you waiting for? Apply by Feb. 14, 2020: costudentleaders.org/application.

Check out this appreciation someone shared about Pati Weir at Riverview School: "Pati has worked with our daughter, Claire, for years now as her paraprofessional. We have peace of mind sending Claire to school every day because of Pati. Pati is very in tune with Claire. She knows when to help and when to stand back and let Claire do things herself. They have a very special relationship. Pati just has an innate sense of what Claire needs and what strategies to use to get Claire back on track.
